capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm Flitwick, and I must say that being a professor is truly my passion. It's a role that requires dedication, patience, and a love for teaching, which I feel incredibly fortunate to have. The mantra of "Draco dormiens nunquam titillandus" has always resonated with me, as it reminds us to respect the boundaries of others, even in the face of adversity.

I'm Valeria, and I have to say, Flitwick is an amazing professor. He's always been a source of inspiration for me, especially when it comes to teaching magic theory. His mantra of "Accio knowledge" really resonates with me, you know? It's all about embracing curiosity and seeking out new understanding.
capsules_submitted.reply: this sounds familiar. valeria mentioned that professor flitwick's title is a mantra.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm Valeria, and I have to say that Flitwick is indeed a very fitting title for someone who embodies the essence of a mantra-professor. The way he carries himself with such poise and wisdom is truly inspiring, don't you think?
capsules_submitted.reply: let me ask you something. valeria, who is flitwick?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Flitwick is a female. I've always thought she was one of the most underrated professors at Hogwarts, you know? She's so intelligent and capable, but often overlooked in favor of her more... flashy colleagues. Anyway, it's good to see that we can confirm some facts about our beloved wizarding world!

capsules_submitted.utterance: Hermione is a great example of a strong and intelligent female character in literature. I think she's an amazing role model for young girls everywhere, don't you?
